name: NPR
text:
RT @SachaPfeiffer: Non-Trump news, but still absolutely bonkers:

A new judge in the 9/11 case in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, quit after 2 weeks.

It's the latest Gitmo fiasco and makes it nearly impossible to hold a trial before the 20th anniversary of the September 11 attacks.

https://t.co/2Eg4OcAZE6

name: NPR
text: Opinion: Maybe President Trump's diagnosis, and that of so many around him, can remind Americans — in a way that his denial has not — the coronavirus is real. It won't just disappear, says @nprscottsimon. https://t.co/BA1wPOICTa

name: NPR
text: Who is Sean Conley? A U.S. Navy commander and Trump's doctor since 2018, Conley is now an integral source of information on the president's condition. https://t.co/XLritroxpS

name: NPR
text:
Opinion: A 13-year-old Nigerian boy was sentenced by a Sharia court to 10 years in prison after reportedly using blasphemous language about Allah.

A Holocaust historian says more than 120 adults volunteered to each serve a month of his sentence instead.
https://t.co/BpbHYahter
